su_1264615: sudo mount -o remount,rw -o exec PATH/TO/YOUR/FILE

When remounting eCryptfs, you need to pass the mount utility the -i parameter to avoid calling the mount helper

sudo mount -o remount,rw -io exec PATH/TO/YOUR/

Explanations about Options.-o:
Use the specified mount options. The opts argument is a comma-separated list. For
 example:
Explanations about Options.-i: Don't call the /sbin/mount.filesystem helper even if it exists.

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_259573: How to install Kali Linux on a usb flashdrive
ul_486921: How do I install a live ISO on an SD card so it boots anywhere?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_259573: cdRom=/path/to/kali.iso
  HDA=/dev/sd[x] # e.g /dev/sda (a hd not part like /dev/sda1) use lsblk
  kvm -cdrom "$cdRom" -hda "$HDA" -m 1024 -boot d

ul_486921: sudo lsblk -fm
sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sdX bs=1M count=1
sudo -H gparted /dev/sdX

sudo lsblk -f             # identify the drive and check the UUID
sudo mount /dev/sdX /mnt  # mount the drive that contains grub.cfg
sudo nano /mnt/boot/grub/grub.cfg  # edit grub.cfg

Explanations about Options.-f:
Output info about filesystems. This option is equivalent to
 -o NAME,FSTYPE,LABEL,UUID,MOUNTPOINT. The authoritative information about
 filesystems and raids is provided by the blkid(8) command.

Top-3 Scripts:
so_64683871: # After I got the physical drive number from powershell (as I would do using lsblk in Linux) I
# formatted the drive using mkfs to ensure it would work before trying to use dd.
sudo mkfs.vfat -I \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE5

# After a successful format, I was able to run dd as normal
sudo dd if=path/to/my/file.iso of=\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE5 status=progress

Explanations about Options.-w:
Use write-mode test. With this option, badblocks scans for bad blocks by writing
 some patterns (0xaa, 0x55, 0xff, 0x00) on every block of the device, reading every
 block and comparing the contents. This option may not be combined with the -n
 option, as they are mutually exclusive.
Explanations about Options.-v:
Verbose mode. Will write the number of read errors, write errors and data-
 corruptions to stderr.

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_486921: How do I install a live ISO on an SD card so it boots anywhere?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_486921: sudo lsblk -f             # identify the drive and check the UUID
sudo mount /dev/sdX /mnt  # mount the drive that contains grub.cfg
sudo nano /mnt/boot/grub/grub.cfg  # edit grub.cfg
